Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the Data structure that keeps track of cards played On the board as well as the direction squares on the board are adjacent Handles Comparisons of cards on the board after plays and modifies the Nodes and WeightedEdges that comprise it. The weight of the edge indicates whether cards are adjacent on their Top, Right, Bottom or Left sides. Nodes are squares on the board that can hold a card, tell what nodes they're adjacent to and whether or not they hold a card. When all nodes hold a card the game is complete.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Keagen Thomson

      Board​(int height, int width)

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayedCards

        public Node[] getPlayedCards()
        Getter for all played cards. Used when selecting a specific Node and when determining if the board is filled and the game is over. Also used when drawing the board's contents to the screen.

      • getPlayedCardNode

        public Node getPlayedCardNode​(int i)
        gets the node at index i

      • attemptPlayCardAt

        public boolean attemptPlayCardAt​(int boardIndex)
        Checks if a card can be played at an index then returns a value indicating if a card can be played there. Used by other objects to test before calling a method to remove a card from their collection.
        Returns:
        returns a boolean indicating if the play was successful

      • playCardAt

        public void playCardAt​(int boardIndex,
                       Card card)
        Plays a card on the board at a specified instance, then tries to capture cards at all adjacent indexes if possible
        Parameters:
        boardIndex - the index calculated after clicking on the view representation of the board
        card - the card to be removed from a card collection and played on the board at the given index

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Getter for board height. shouldn't change after construction of board.

      • getPlayedCardTotal

        public int getPlayedCardTotal​(java.lang.String player)
        Iterates through every card on the board and adds to the player count total if it equals the input string
        Parameters:
        player - the owner attribute that's either "Player 1" or "Player 2"
        Returns:
        the amount of cards a player has on the board

        public int getWidth()
        Getter for board height. shouldn't change after construction of board.
